capabilities.description: Native slash command syntax (e.g., /gsd:new-project)

notes.claude: Full /gsd:* command support via native slash command system
notes.copilot: Use skills with $get-shit-done instead of /gsd:* commands
notes.codex: Use skills with $get-shit-done instead of /gsd:* commands

capabilities.description: Add phase to end of current milestone in roadmap
Capture idea or task as todo from current conversation context
Audit milestone completion against original intent before archiving
List pending todos and select one to work on
Archive completed milestone and prepare for next version
Systematic debugging with persistent state across context resets
Gather phase context through adaptive questioning before planning
Execute all plans in a phase with wave-based parallelization
Show available GSD commands and usage guide
Insert urgent work as decimal phase (e.g., 72.1) between existing phases
Invoke a GSD agent with a custom prompt across any CLI
Surface Claude's assumptions about a phase approach before planning
Analyze codebase with parallel mapper agents to produce .planning/codebase/ documents
Start a new milestone cycle â€” update PROJECT.md and route to requirements
Initialize a new project with deep context gathering and PROJECT.md
Create context handoff when pausing work mid-phase
Create phases to close all gaps identified by milestone audit
Create detailed execution plan for a phase (PLAN.md) with verification loop
Check project progress, show context, and route to next action (execute or plan)
Remove a future phase from roadmap and renumber subsequent phases
Research how to implement a phase (standalone - usually use /gsd:plan-phase instead)
Resume work from previous session with full context restoration
Update GSD to latest version with changelog display
Run comprehensive installation verification
Validate built features through conversational UAT
See what's new in GSD since your installed version
Write-then-rename for crash-safe state updates
Automatic fallback to alternate CLI if primary unavailable
Define project-specific agents for specialized workflows
Multi-process coordination for concurrent CLI usage
Run multiple agents concurrently for faster execution

notes.claude: No limitations on concurrent agent invocation
notes.copilot: No limitations on concurrent agent invocation
notes.codex: No limitations on concurrent agent invocation

capabilities.description: Save and restore work context across CLI sessions
Detect and repair corrupted planning state
Track agent invocations and costs per CLI
